Example 1 - Just Trying to Help

Read the scenario below, then select CONTINUE to answer some questions.

The President of a family-owned bank made numerous large loans to a local real estate developer. When these loans became delinquent, the President used funds from various unrelated loans to pay on the delinquent loans. The President manipulated the bank's records to conceal this activity. The dominant President frequently intimidated newer young employees to comply with the requests.

Several other employees began noticing various red flags and brought them to the attention of the Chairman, who was the bank President's father. On several occasions, the Chairman indicated that he would look into it. However, by the time the fraud was discovered, it was too late. Although the President never received any personal benefits, the President caused the bank to fail through his actions.

Eventually, the President pled guilty to one count of misapplication of bank funds and was sentenced to 24-months plus 5-years supervised release. The developer pled guilty to three counts of bank fraud and was sentenced to 87 months.
